title: Understanding Autism in Early Childhood: Signs Parents Should Know
excerpt: Early detection is key. Learn about the early signs of autism and what steps you can take to support your child's development.
author: Admin
content:
Recognizing the early signs of autism can make a significant difference in a child's development. This article guides parents through common indicators and the importance of early intervention.

Common Early Signs

  • Limited eye contact
  • Delayed speech or loss of previously acquired speech
  • Repetitive behaviors or movements
  • Lack of response to name

If you notice these signs, consult with a developmental pediatrician or child psychologist for an assessment.
